org.apache.hadoop.fs.s3a

Class S3ARetryPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.fs.s3a.S3ARetryPolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.hadoop.io.retry.RetryPolicy
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    S3GuardExistsRetryPolicy

    public class S3ARetryPolicy
extends Object
implements org.apache.hadoop.io.retry.RetryPolicy
    The S3A request retry policy. This uses the retry options in the configuration file to determine retry count and delays for "normal" retries and separately, for throttling; the latter is best handled for longer with an exponential back-off.
    1. Those exceptions considered unrecoverable (networking) are failed fast.
    2. All non-IOEs are failed immediately. Assumed: bugs in code, unrecoverable errors, etc
    For non-idempotent operations, only failures due to throttling or from failures which are known to only arise prior to talking to S3 are retried. The retry policy is all built around that of the normal IO exceptions, particularly those extracted from S3AUtils.translateException(String, Path, AmazonClientException). Because the shouldRetry(Exception, int, int, boolean) method does this translation if an AmazonClientException is processed, the policy defined for the IOEs also applies to the original exceptions. Put differently: this retry policy aims to work for handlers of the untranslated exceptions, as well as the translated ones.
    See Also:
    S3 Error responses, Amazon S3 Error Best Practices, Dynamo DB Commmon errors

      protected org.apache.hadoop.io.retry.RetryPolicy connectivityFailure

      No retry on network and tangible API issues.
      protected org.apache.hadoop.io.retry.RetryPolicy fixedRetries
      Base policy from configuration.
      protected org.apache.hadoop.io.retry.RetryPolicy retryIdempotentCalls
      Rejection of all non-idempotent calls except specific failures.
      protected org.apache.hadoop.io.retry.RetryPolicy throttlePolicy
      Policy for throttle requests, which are considered repeatable, even for non-idempotent calls, as the service rejected the call entirely.
